intro: Hieracium farreilimbatum, commonly known as the Farreil's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually basal, with a rough, hairy texture, and its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped cluster. It is an herbaceous perennial that can form dense mats, often competing with other vegetation in its habitat.
